content.title: Configuring the UI from Action Editor
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Widget section, select Set Widget Property.
  2. From the right pane, under Mobile Forms > frmAddRecipients > flexAddRecipient > flexFieldsContainer > flexAdd > flexBorderedButton, and then select btnSquared.
  3. In the right pane, modify the following values:
    • Property: Opacity
    • Value: 100 %

content.title: Adding a Snippet
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Function section, select Add Snippet.
  2. In the right pane, provide the following code:
    self.view.forceLayout();
  3. From the Action Editor canvas, under INVOKE SERVICE node, select CALLBACK.

content.title: Failure Alert
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Condition section, select Else.
  2. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Client section, select Show Alert.
  3. In the right pane modify the following fields
    • Alert Type: Info
    • Alert Message: “Sorry, your payee could not be added successfully. Please try again later.”
  4. Click Save.

content.title: Create Add Recipients Screen
content.body:
1. From the Project explorer, expand Mobile.
  2. Right-click Forms and select New Form.
  3. Right-click on Form1, and rename frmAddRecipient.

content.title: Congratulations
content.body:
You’ve successfully:

  • Created the create recipients screen
  • Created and customized the UI for the create recipients screen
  • Added navigation to and from the Create Recipients screen

For more information about editing the recipients in your app, check out the next hike: 8. Add Edit Recipients Feature.

content.title: Adding Create Recipient
content.body:
Let’s get started!

In this hike, you will learn how to:

  • Create a create payee form
  • Create the UI for the create payee form using services

Before you get started, complete the hike:

  1. Import & Launch a Native App
  2. Create UI from Collections
  3. Add Authentication to the App
  4. Creating Services for a Native App
  5. Connect App UI to Data in a Native App
  6. Creating Recipient Details and Delete Feature
    7.

Ensure that you open the same project that you have created in the previous hikes.

To open a closed project, from the main menu, navigate to Project > Open > Kony Reference Architecture > RecipientsMobApp.

When you are ready, click Start!

content.title: Adding Navigation for Back Button
content.body:
1. From the Project explorer, navigate to frmAddRecipient > flexAddRecipient > flexHeader, select headerButtonLeft.
  2. From the Properties panel, navigate to the Action tab.
  3. For the onClick event, click Edit.
    The Action Editor window appears.

content.title: Adding Navigation for Back Button
content.body:
1. From the Action Editor left menu, under the General section, select Navigate to Form.
  2. From the right pane of the Action Editor, select frmRecipients.
  3. Click Save.

content.title: Navigating to Add Recipients Screen
content.body:
1. From the Action Editor left menu, under the General section, select Navigate to Form.
  2. From the right pane of the Action Editor, select frmAddRecipient.
  3. Click Save.

content.title: Navigation to Accounts Screen
content.body:
1. From the Project explorer, navigate to Mobile > Forms > frmAddRecipients > flexFooter and select flxAccounts.
  2. From the Properties panel, navigate to the Action tab.
  3. Under the General section, for the onClick event, click Edit.
    The Action Editor window appears.

content.title: Navigation to Accounts Screen
content.body:
1. From the Action Editor left menu, under the General section, select Navigate to Form.
  2. From the right pane of the Action Editor, select frmAccount.
  3. Click Save.

content.title: Navigating to Add Recipients Screen
content.body:
1. From the Projectexplorer, navigate to Mobile > Forms > frmRecipients > flexRecipientList > flexHeader, and select headerButtonRight.
  2. From the Properties panel, navigate to the Action tab.
  3. Under the General section, for the onClick event, click Edit.
    The Action Editor window appears.

content.title: Navigation to Recipients Screen
content.body:
1. From the Project explorer, navigate to Mobile > Forms > frmAddRecipient > flexFooter and select flexRecipientSelected.
  2. From the Properties panel, navigate to the Action tab.
  3. Under the General section, for the onClick event, click Edit.
    The Action Editor window appears.

content.title: Navigating to Recipients Screen
content.body:
1. From the Action Editor left menu, under the General section, select Navigate to Form.
  2. From the right pane of the Action Editor, select frmRecipients.
  3. Click Save.

content.title: Quantum App
content.body:
1. Connect your mobile device to your computer using a USB cable.
    For an Android mobile device, ensure that the USB is set as Transfer files.
    For an iOS mobile device, ensure that trust has been established between the device and the computer.
  2. Launch your Quantum App on your mobile device.
  3. Select the USB tab.
    On a successful connection, Visualizer on your computer shows a success prompt.

content.title: Run the App
content.body:
1. From the left navigation bar, click Run.
    It will take some time for Visualizer to display the Live Preview is ready window.
  2. After Visualizer runs the app, on your Quantum App, click Launch.
  3. You may see an Application Name text box. If there is a text box, enter RecipientsMobApp, and then click Launch.

content.title: Setting Initial Value for the Texts
content.body:
1. From the Project explorer, navigate to Mobile > Forms and select frmAddRecipient.
  2. From the Properties panel, navigate to the Action tab.
  3. Under the General section, for onNavigate event, click Edit.
    The Action Editor window appears.
  4. From the top-right corner of the Action Editor, select Design View.

content.title: Setting the Value of First Name
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Widget section, select Set Widget Property.
  2. From the right pane of the Action Editor, go to Mobile Forms > frmAddRecipient  > flexAddRecipient > flexFieldsContainer > flexFirstName, and select tbxFirstName.
  3. In the right pane, modify the following values:
    • Property: Text
    • leave the Value as blank

content.title: Setting the Value of the Last Name
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Widget section, select Set Widget Property.
  2. From the right pane of the Action Editor, go to Mobile Forms > frmAddRecipient > flexAddRecipient > flexFieldsContainer > flexLastName, and select tbxLastName.
  3. In the right pane, modify the following values:
    • Property: Text
    • leave the Value as blank

content.title: Setting the Value of Nick Name
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Widget section, select Set Widget Property.
  2. From the right pane of the Action Editor, go to Mobile Forms > frmAddRecipient > flexAddRecipient > flexFieldsContainer > flexNickName, and select tbxNickName.
  3. In the right pane, modify the following values:
    • Property: Text
    • leave the Value as blank

content.title: Setting the Value of Phone Number
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Widget section, select Set Widget Property.
  2. From the right pane of the Action Editor, go to Mobile Forms > frmAddRecipient > flexAddRecipient > flexFieldsContainer > flexPhone, and select tbxPhone.
  3. In the right pane, modify the following values:
    • Property: Text
    • leave the Value as blank

content.title: Success Message
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Widget section, select Set Widget Property.
  2. From the right pane of the Action Editor, go to Mobile Forms > frmAddRecipient > flexAddRecipient and select flexSuccessHeader.
  3. In the right pane, modify the following values:
    • Property: Visible
    • Value: False
  4. Click Save.

content.title: Invoking Create Operation
content.body:
1. From the Project explorer, navigate to Mobile > Forms > frmAddRecipient > flexAddRecipient > flexFieldsContainer > flexAdd > flexSquaredBorderedButton, and select btnSquared.
  2. From the Properties panel, navigate to the Action tab.
  3. Under the General section, for onClick event, click Edit.
    The Action Editor window appears.
  4. From the top-right corner of the Action Editor window, select the Design View.

content.title: Invoking Create Operation
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Network section, select Loading Indicator.
  2. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the NETWORK section, select Invoke Service.
  3. From the right pane of the Action Editor, for Select Service, from the drop-down list, select RecipientStorage$Recipients.
  4. For Select Method, from the drop-down list, select create.

content.title: Mapping the Data to Service
content.body:
1. In the right pane of the Action Editor window, click Open Mapping Editor.
    The Mapping Editor window appears.
  2. From the left pane of the Mapping Editor, expand Forms > frmAddRecipient.
  3. From the right pane of the Mapping Editor, expand Services > Service - RecipientStorage$Recipients$create.

content.title: Mapping the Data to Service
content.body:
In the Mapping Editor, map the following elements from the left pane to the right pane:

  • From the left pane of the Mapping Editor, expand TextField – tbxFirstName, and select text{string}.
    From the right pane of the Mapping Editor, select FirstName {string}.
  • From the left pane of the Mapping Editor, expand TextField – tbxLastName, and select text{string}.
    From the right pane of the Mapping Editor, select LastName {string}.
  • From the left pane of the Mapping Editor, expand TextField – tbxNickName, and select text{string}.
    From the right pane of the Mapping Editor, select NickName {string}.
  • From the left pane of the Mapping Editor, expand TextField – tbxPhone, and select text{string}.
    From the right pane of the Mapping Editor, select Phone {string}.

content.title: Invoking Create Operation
content.body:
1. From the Action Editor canvas, under the Invoke Service node, select Callback.
  2. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Network section, select Loading Indicator.
  3. In the right pane of the Action Editor, set the Loading Indicator to Dismiss.

content.title: Setting the Data
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the CONDITION section, select If.
  2. From the right pane of the Action Editor, under Add Condition modify the following values:
    • First field – Value
    • Second field – Recipients.opstatus
    • Third field – Equals
    • Fourth field – Value
    • Fifth field - 0

content.title: Success Message
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Widgetsection, select Set Widget Property.
  2. From the right pane, under Mobile Forms > frmAddRecipient > flexFieldsContainer, and select flexAddSuccessHeader.
  3. In the right pane, modify the following values:
    • Property: Visible
    • Value: True

content.title: Setting Button Opacity
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Widget section, select Set Widget Property.
  2. From the right pane, under Mobile > Forms > frmAddRecipient > flexAddRecipient > flexFieldsContainer > flexAdd > flexBorderedButton, select btnSquared.
  3. In the right pane, modify the following values:
    • Property: Opacity
    • Value: 60%

content.title: Setting Delay
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under FUNCTION select Add Snippet.
  2. In the right pane of the Action Editor, type the following code:
    self.view.forceLayout();
  3. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the GENERAL section,  select Set Timeout.
  4. Provide the following value:
    • Delay: 2

content.title: Success Message
content.body:
1. From the left menu of the Action Editor, under the Widget section, select Set Widget Property.
  2. From the right pane, under Mobile > Forms > frmAddRecipient > flexAddRecipient, select flexAddSuccessHeader.
  3. In the right pane, modify the following values:
    • Property: Visible
    • Value: False

content.title: UI for Adding Recipients
content.body:
1. From the bottom-left corner of Visualizer, navigate to the Default Library.
  2. Next to the Default Library, you will see the My Libraries tab and a search icon.
    Click the search icon.
  3. In the search bar that appears, enter AddRecipient.
  4. From the results, under RecipientsMobile, select AddRecipient.
  5. Drag the AddRecipient collection onto the frmAddRecipient on the canvas.

content.title: View the App
content.body:
1. Enter the following login credentials in your app.
    • Username: john.doe@temenos.com
    • Password: Temenos@123
  2. Click Login.
    The Accounts List appears.
  3. Click Recipients.
    The Recipient list appears.
  4. Click the add (+) icon to add a recipient.
  5. Select a recipient from the list to view their details.
    From the details page, you can delete the recipient.
    We will be adding the edit functionality of recipients in the next hike.
  6. To exit the app on your mobile device, swipe two fingers from left to right or shake your mobile device and click Exit App.
